examples: There is a debate going on right now between the two parties.

senses.definition: (+ To) Proceed to do or tackle STH after doing STH else
examples: Does anyone have any questions before I go on to the next chapter?

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context: GO ON
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Mr. Williams, Project Manager. Something serious has happened at the company and Mr. Williams needs to inform you about the situation. He appears concerned and wants to discuss this important matter with you.

scenario.situation: Something serious has happened at the company and Mr. Williams needs to inform you about the situation. He appears concerned and wants to discuss this important matter with you.
scenario.contextText: Something serious has happened at the company and Mr. Williams needs to inform you about the situation. He appears concerned and wants to discuss this important matter with you.
scenario.conversationStarter: Something bad has happened in the company.

examples: There is a debate going on right now between the two parties.
What's going on with the company situation?
Something serious is going on here.

senses.definition: Get or take SB/STH from a place
examples: Can you pick up some food on the way home from work please?

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context: PICK UP
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Mr. Johnson, Team Leader. There's an important meeting starting soon with guests from China, but the food for the meeting has not arrived yet. The situation is becoming urgent and someone needs to get the food quickly.

scenario.situation: There's an important meeting starting soon with guests from China, but the food for the meeting has not arrived yet. The situation is becoming urgent and someone needs to get the food quickly.
scenario.contextText: There's an important meeting starting soon with guests from China, but the food for the meeting has not arrived yet. The situation is becoming urgent and someone needs to get the food quickly.
scenario.conversationStarter: The meeting with our Chinese guests starts in 30 minutes, but the food hasn't arrived yet!

targetLexicalItem.definition: Get or take SB/STH from a place
examples: Can you pick up some food on the way home from work please?
I can pick up the food from the restaurant right now.
We need someone to pick up the catering for the meeting.

senses.definition: Return to a place or a conversation topic
examples: She came back to the kitchen with a bottle of fancy wine.

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context: COME BACK
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Ms. Smith, Project Manager. Ms. Smith has just left the office to work from home for the rest of the day. However, something urgent has come up that requires her immediate attention in the office.

scenario.situation: Ms. Smith has just left the office to work from home for the rest of the day. However, something urgent has come up that requires her immediate attention in the office.
scenario.contextText: Ms. Smith has just left the office to work from home for the rest of the day. However, something urgent has come up that requires her immediate attention in the office.
scenario.conversationStarter: I've just left the office to work from home for the day.

targetLexicalItem.definition: Return to a place or a conversation topic
examples: She came back to the kitchen with a bottle of fancy wine.
Could you come back to the office? Something urgent has come up.
He needs to come back to the meeting room for the presentation.

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context: CLOSE DOWN
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You are the CEO speaking with Mr. Smith, Regional Manager. Mr. Smith is reporting that one of the offices has been underperforming significantly. As the CEO, you need to consider the difficult decision of potentially closing down the office.

scenario.situation: Mr. Smith is reporting to the CEO that one of the offices has been underperforming significantly. As the CEO, you need to consider the difficult decision of potentially closing down the office.
scenario.contextText: Mr. Smith is reporting to the CEO that one of the offices has been underperforming significantly. As the CEO, you need to consider the difficult decision of potentially closing down the office.
scenario.conversationStarter: CEO, I need to update you on our regional office performance. One of our offices has been consistently underperforming.

examples: If this continues, we might have to close down that office.
The CEO decided to close down the underperforming division.
